comment.author: 22998675@N06
comment._content:
OCEANA: 6,168 grt; 468 x 52; Harland & Wolff, Belfast, 1888; Australia service; 250 First class, 150 Second class passengers; sisters: ARCADIA; 
Mar.16, 1912: Sank off Eastbourne after a collision with the barque Pisagua, while bound from London to Bombay.

comment.author: 22968943@N05
comment._content: "PRINTED ON ILFORD BROMIDE" - suggests this is a picture of a print and not an "original" negative - I've noticed a lot of these images seem to be like that.  I guess it was fairly common to make "copies" like that back then?
